sentence.Network_cn: 他对巫术魔法情有独钟。

sentence.Network_en: Were not all things charged with occult virtues?

sentence.Network_en: He and the black - leather fellow looked very occult.
sentence.Network_cn: 他和那个象黑皮革似的家伙显得很神秘.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as a verb): from Latin occultare 'secrete', frequentative of occulere 'conceal', based on celare 'to hide'; the adjective and noun from occult- 'covered over', from the verb occulere

entry.def: The occult is the knowledge and study of supernatural or magical forces.

means.word_mean: 1. supernatural forces and events and beings collectively;

sentences.sentence: "he is a student of the occult"

means.word_mean: 1. cause an eclipse of (a celestial body) by intervention;

sentences.sentence: "Planets and stars often are occulted by other celestial bodies"

means.word_mean: 2. become concealed or hidden from view or have its light extinguished;

sentences.sentence: "The beam of light occults every so often"

means.word_mean: 2. having an import not apparent to the senses nor obvious to the intelligence; beyond ordinary understanding;

stems_affixes.word_buile: oc向内+cult教派→在教派内不让别人知道
agri农业+culture培养,文化→引申为养殖业→农业
aqui水+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.[生物]水产养殖
arbori=arbor+culture[n.文化,文明;修养;耕种;栽培,培育]→n.树木的培植
cult耕种,培养→培养[感情]→崇拜,引申为教派
cultivate[v.耕作,栽培,养殖;培养,教养,磨炼]+ion动作或状态→n.耕作,培养
